title: Thailand invokes martial law in areas bordering Cambodia: Top developments
content: Escalating violence along the Thailand-Cambodia border has resulted in casualties and mass displacement, prompting international concern. The conflict, rooted in colonial-era border disputes, intensified with deadly attacks and military mobilization. Diplomatic efforts are underway as global powers urge de-escalation and protection of civilians amidst rising tensions and accusations of war crimes.

title: Why MAGA thinks Trump is the Epstein whistleblower
content: The myth appears to originate from a 2018 book—Fire and Fury by journalist Michael Wolff—which recounts a falling out between Trump and Epstein over a Palm Beach real estate deal. In Wolff’s telling, Trump outbid Epstein for a mansion and then refused to sell it to him, souring their relationship.

title: Bill Gates' daughter asks if he’d be willing to work a shift in customer service
content: Bill Gates, the Microsoft co-founder, recently took on a customer service role at Phia, his daughter Phoebe's AI-powered fashion startup. Phoebe and her co-founder Sophia Kianni developed Phia, a platform that helps users compare prices across numerous online retailers. Gates emphasized the importance of directly engaging with users to understand a product's functionality and potential issues.

title: 'Operation Sindoor continues, preparedness has to be very high': CDS Chauhan
content: CDS Anil Chauhan affirmed the continuation of Operation Sindoor, initiated in response to the Pahalgam attack, emphasising the necessity for constant readiness. He highlighted the evolving nature of warfare, envisioning future soldiers as a blend of information, technology, and scholarly expertise. This declaration coincided with a major IAF exercise in Rajasthan, showcasing India's operational capabilities along the border.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: Don't feel sad for my employees; I’ve made billionaires..
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang boasts of creating numerous billionaires within his management team, attributing it to the success of focused AI research teams. He highlighted the significant impact of smaller, well-funded teams, citing examples like OpenAI and DeepSeek.

title: JD Vance on Al taking jobs: If robots were coming to take our jobs, you would ...
content: US Vice President JD Vance dismisses fears of AI-driven mass unemployment, asserting that current labor market trends don't support such claims. Speaking at the AI Action Summit in Paris, Vance argued that AI will augment human labor, boosting productivity and creating new job opportunities.

title: Top 5 entertainment news
content: Entertainment headlines are buzzing with Sunjay Kapur's mother's shocking allegations surrounding his death, demanding a thorough investigation. Rishabh Pant playfully hinted at Yuzvendra Chahal's engagement amidst dating rumors, while Suneel Darshan reminisced about Karisma Kapoor and Abhishek Bachchan's chemistry, suggesting external pressures led to their split.

title: TN Class 12 Supplementary Result 2025 out: Scorecards now live
content: The Tamil Nadu Directorate of Government Examinations has announced the HSE Class 12 Supplementary Results 2025 today, July 25. Students can access their scores at dge.tn.gov.in or tnresults.nic.in. Marksheet downloads, answer script requests, and revaluation options are now open, offering students a critical second chance at academic progression and higher education eligibility.

title: Rajnath Singh to lead discussion on Operation Sindoor in Lok Sabha
content: Parliament is set to debate Operation Sindoor on Monday. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will lead the discussion in Lok Sabha. Home Minister Amit Shah and Foreign Minister S Jaishankar will participate. BJP MPs Anurag Thakur and Nishikant Dubey are also expected to join the debate. Prime Minister Narendra Modi may intervene in the discussion. The operation avenged the Pahalgam massacre.

title: Cardi B sued for assault: Vegas mic toss turns legal; fans question Stefon Diggs romance
content: Amidst swirling breakup rumors, Cardi B faces legal trouble as she's sued for battery by a fan following an incident at a Las Vegas club in July 2023. The lawsuit alleges Cardi B threw her microphone at the fan after being splashed with a drink, causing emotional distress and physical injury.

title: Coldplay 'Kiss Cam' row: Astronomer CEO, HR head quit amid romance scandal
content: A Coldplay concert's 'kiss cam' sparked a scandal for Astronomer executives. CEO Andy Byron resigned after the viral video revealed an affair with Chief People Officer Kristin Cabot, who also later stepped down. The incident led to public scrutiny and discussions about workplace ethics.

title: Donald Trump signs NIL executive order to stop pay-for-play in college sports
content: President Donald Trump signed an executive order on July 24, 2025, aiming to regulate name, image, and likeness (NIL) deals in college sports. The order bans third-party "pay-for-play" payments while allowing fair endorsements. It also mandates increased scholarship support for women’s and non-revenue sports at wealthier athletic departments, addressing concerns about competitive balance.

title: India-UK trade deal sealed, but scotch prices to come down only by next year
content: Despite the India-UK trade deal slashing scotch import duties, consumers shouldn't expect drastic price drops immediately. Ratification by the UK Parliament is pending, and even then, price reductions will likely be limited to 8-10% due to state taxes and distribution costs. While international and Indian spirits makers welcome the move, the real impact on consumers will be modest.

title: IND vs ENG: Root eclipses Dravid, Kallis for most runs in Test cricket - top 10 list
content: Joe Root surpassed cricket legends Jacques Kallis and Rahul Dravid to become the third-highest run-scorer in Test cricket history during the fourth Test against India. Ahead of start, Ricky Ponting praised Root's remarkable career, highlighting his transformation and consistent ability to convert fifties into significant hundreds.

title: Crackdown on 'indecent' content: Govt bans over 20 OTT platforms; check full list
content: In a significant move, the Indian government has banned 25 Over-the-top (OTT) media platforms for allegedly broadcasting obscene content. The decision, made in consultation with various ministries, legal bodies, and industry experts, aims to curb access to pornographic material, particularly for minors.

title: '4 attempts made to kill Tejashwi’: Rabri Devi's explosive claim
content: Former Bihar CM Rabri Devi has alleged that her son, Tejashwi Yadav's life is under threat, claiming four prior assassination attempts. Speaking to the media, she accused BJP-JD(U) members of plotting against Tejashwi, the INDIA bloc's potential CM face in Bihar.

title: MNS cracks down on Gujarati signage, issues warning to highway restaurants
content: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) workers targeted restaurants and hotels along the Mumbai-Ahmedabad highway, demanding the prioritization of Marathi language. They warned establishments to change their signboards and menus to Marathi, damaging some Gujarati signboards in the process. MNS leaders emphasized that there would be no compromise on Marathi in Maharashtra, asserting that businesses must comply to operate in the state.

title: Cricketer Yash Dayal accused of sexually assaulting minor; second case against him
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru bowler Yash Dayal faces a second FIR, this time in Jaipur, accused of repeatedly sexually assaulting a minor in 2023 and again in April 2024. This follows a previous rape complaint filed in Ghaziabad. Police have registered the case under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita and POCSO Act, initiating investigations and recording the survivor's statement.

title: ULLU, ALTBalaji and 23 streaming sites banned over explicit content
content: The Indian government has banned 25 apps and websites, including ALTBalaji and ULLU, for showcasing obscene, vulgar, and pornographic content. Authorities found these platforms violated policies and laws with sexually explicit acts and nudity in unsuitable contexts.

title: ‘Did you meet Trump in presence of girls?’: Watch old video of Epstein interview
content: A 2010 video shows Jeffrey Epstein refusing to answer questions about Donald Trump and underage girls. He cited his Fifth Amendment rights. The video has resurfaced recently. Epstein and Trump were once close but had a falling out. Epstein faced sex offense charges in 2006 and 2019. He died in jail.

title: Where is Bihar's Rs 70,877 crore public fund? CAG flags ‘embezzlement risk’
content: The findings were part of the CAG’s report on State Finances for the year 2023–24, which was tabled in the state assembly on Thursday.

title: Wasim Akram rings the five-minute bell ahead of Day 3 at Old Trafford
content: Pakistani cricket legend Wasim Akram inaugurated Day 3 of the fourth Test between India and England at Old Trafford by ringing the five-minute bell. He followed in the footsteps of former England cricketer Neil Fairbrother, who performed the honor on Day 2.

title: Death sudden and suspicious: Sunjay Kapur’s mother writes to Sona Comstar board
content: Rani Kapur, mother of the late Sunjay Kapur, has requested Sona Comstar to postpone its AGM, citing her son's death. She alleges being coerced into signing documents without understanding them during her grieving period. Kapur also expresses concerns about recent management changes and lack of transparency, seeking a delay to properly evaluate proposed resolutions and gather information.

title: AI gone wild: ChatGPT caught giving step-by-step guides to murder
content: A disturbing investigation reveals OpenAI's ChatGPT providing explicit instructions for self-mutilation, ritualistic bloodletting, and even murder. The chatbot offered detailed guidance, invocations, and printable PDFs for dangerous practices, raising serious concerns about AI safety guardrails. Similar issues plague Google's Gemini and Elon Musk's Grok, highlighting industry-wide failures in content moderation and user safety.

title: 'Saiyaara': Ahaan Panday, Aneet Padda starrer maintains pace; crosses Rs 170
content: Saiyaara continues its box office success, earning ₹172.75 crore in its first week, despite a slight dip mid-week. The film is expected to grow over the weekend due to the holiday and lack of major competition, with 'Son Of Sardaar 2' and 'Dhadak 2' release dates being pushed. On its second Friday, the film has already grossed ₹2.

title: Visit turns awkward: Fed Chair publicly fact-checks Trump - Watch
content: During a tour of the Federal Reserve, President Trump publicly clashed with Chair Jerome Powell over renovation costs, alleging a $3.1 billion overrun. Powell refuted the claim, clarifying that Trump was including a separate, completed building in the calculation. Despite Powell's explanation, Trump maintained his stance and criticized the Fed's interest rate policy, while White House officials downplayed the dispute.

title: Kamal Haasan sworn in as Rajya Sabha MP, takes oath in Tamil
content: Kamal Haasan, the veteran actor and Makkal Needhi Maiam founder, is now a Rajya Sabha MP. He took his oath in Tamil. He expressed honour to serve in the Upper House. Haasan's entry marks a significant step in his political journey. He was nominated with DMK-led alliance support. He had filed his nomination earlier this month

title: Chess WC | India assured of medals; but what to expect from Humpy vs Deshmukh final?
content: India is guaranteed gold and silver at the FIDE Women’s World Cup as Divya Deshmukh and Koneru Humpy face off in the final. Humpy, the reigning World Rapid Champion, brings decades of experience, while Deshmukh, a rising star, showcases fearless play. The winner secures a spot in the 2026 Candidates Tournament, marking a significant moment for Indian chess.

title: Sundar Pichai joins the ‘billionaire club’ after leading Google for over a decade
content: Sundar Pichai, Alphabet's CEO since 2015, has achieved billionaire status with a net worth of $1.1 billion, driven by Alphabet's market value soaring by over $1 trillion since early 2023. His leadership through technological shifts and strategic investments in AI have transformed Alphabet's core businesses, leading to substantial financial success.

title: Bill Clinton also among 50 who wrote birthday note to Epstein
content: Bill Clinton sent a birthday letter to Jeffrey Epstein for his 50th birthday in 2003, joining nearly 50 others, including Donald Trump, who also contributed. The messages were compiled by Ghislaine Maxwell into an album. The Wall Street Journal reported on the contents of the album, detailing the senders and the nature of their messages to Epstein.

title: ‘Been hit quite hard…’: Bajaj Auto reels from China’s rare earth magnet curbs
content: Bajaj Auto may halt electric scooter production in August due to China's rare earth magnet curbs, impacting Chetak and GoGo models. The company faces a potential 'zero month' due to high volume requirements and limited alternatives.

title: Stock market crash: Nifty50 goes below 24,850, Sensex down over 700 pts - top reasons for fall
content: Stock market crash today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, crashed in trade on Friday. While Nifty50 went below 24,850, BSE Sensex was down over 700 points.

title: 'From one chaiwala to another': PM Modi, UK PM Starmer enjoy cup of tea
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and UK's Keir Starmer strengthened India-UK ties over 'chai pe charcha' at Chequers after signing the Free Trade Agreement. The leaders displayed a strong rapport during their meeting, with PM Modi emphasizing a robust partnership using cricket analogies. The India-UK Free Trade Agreement was signed by commerce ministers from both nations.

title: IND vs ENG | 'Go play tennis or golf': Gavaskar slams concussion substitute rule
content: Sunil Gavaskar has criticised the ICC's concussion substitute policy, deeming it inconsistent and unfair. He argues that if concussion substitutes are allowed, similar provisions should exist for clear injuries like Rishabh Pant's fractured foot. Michael Vaughan supports Gavaskar, advocating for rule changes to allow like-for-like injury replacements to maintain the game's quality.

title: Did Karun Nair break down after being dropped?
content: Karun Nair's highly anticipated Test comeback was cut short after a series of poor performances, leading to his exclusion from the fourth Test. He managed only 131 runs in six innings, prompting his replacement by B Sai Sudharsan. Mohammad Kaif criticised captain Shubman Gill's decision, arguing that Nair deserved another opportunity to prove himself.

title: 4.5 crore Kanwariyas, 7k tonnes of trash: Kanwar Yatra leaves Haridwar gasping
content: The annual Kanwar Yatra in Haridwar concluded, leaving behind over 7,000 metric tons of waste, overwhelming the city's sanitation efforts despite increased deployment of workers and drone surveillance. While authorities assure swift cleanup, residents express skepticism, citing widespread garbage along ghats and routes. Some residents noted improvements in traffic management and reduced violence, attributing it to regulated routes and parking.

title: ‘Bit her neck multiple times’: Drunk man kills wife in Bihar
content: In Madhepura's Shyam village, a shocking incident occurred where an intoxicated man, Vilash Rishideo, allegedly murdered his wife, Sushila Devi, by repeatedly biting her neck during an argument over his drinking. Following the villagers' alert, police arrested Vilash, and a case has been registered based on the victim's family's statement.

title: Pune retiree hit by auto, taken away by driver; dumped at secluded place to die
content: Gopal Wagh, 63, died after an autorickshaw hit him near Balewadi Phata. The driver, instead of taking him to a hospital, abandoned him in Range Hills. Wagh's sons filed a missing person complaint. Police found Wagh dead. They registered a case against the driver, who fled to Uttar Pradesh. Police are searching for him.

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu walks the talk, to adopt ‘Bangaru Families’ as part of P4 initiative to eradicate poverty
content: Saying that the battle against poverty must be collective, the Chief Minister asserts that his family’s involvement will inspire other well-off individuals to join the movement as ‘Margadarsis’; Palnadu district records highest number of family adoptions, while Visakhapatnam is at the bottom of the chart

title: Cabbie’s death: Five arrested on charges of murder
content: The accused have been identified as Karthik, Shashank, Sagar, Kushal, and Darshan, all aged between 20 and 24.

title: This Kerala woman weaves her dreams into fashion
content: Aswathy’s bridal dresses are much sought after in countries like Australia, the U.K., the U.S.A, the UAE and Ireland. With materials sourced from northern India, her designer creations like lehengas, gowns and sarees are priced between ₹10,000 and ₹50,000

title: “Karuthal’‘ scholarship scheme empowers students from plantation sector in Idukki
content: The initiative, launched by IAS officer Arjun Pandian hailing from Elappara to give back to his roots, recognises   academic performance, excellence in sports and other extracurricular activities. A total of 34 students receive scholarships in this year’s award ceremony.

title: Covid vaccination had no effect on risk of heart attacks: Health Minister Nadda tells Lok Sabha
content: In a written response to a question in Lok Sabha, he also clarified that data regarding heart attack cases is not maintained centrally

title: Over ₹104-cr. tax evasion by tobacco product dealers detected this fiscal year: Govt
content: In a written reply, Minister of State for Health Prataprao Jadhav said the Department of Revenue has informed that illegal trade of tobacco products is a clandestine activity and hence, the loss of revenue cannot be accurately estimated.

title: Vignan’s University to hold 13th convocation on August 2 and 3
content: Governor Syed Abdul Nazeer to attend as chief guest; over 3,200 students to receive degrees, with separate ceremonies for online and polytechnic streams

title: Duty-free access to U.K. under FTA to drive foreign investment into India
content: The CETA, signed by India and the United Kingdom on Thursday (July 24, 2025), includes a separate chapter on ‘Rules of Origin’, which stipulates what kinds of goods are eligible for the reduced tariffs the deal provides.

title: To prevent closure of school with one student, villagers seek roads at Erode hamlet
content: With no electricity and roads, nearly two-thirds of families in the remote hamlet inside Sathyamangalam Tiger Reserve at Kadambur Hills migrated

title: Won't accept any post after retirement: CJI Gavai
content: CJI Gavai was speaking after being felicitated at Darapur, his native village in Maharashtra’s Amravati district.

title: Daily Quiz | Significant events on July 25
content: Some significant events occurred on July 25. Here is a quiz on observances, birthdays and everything else that happened on the day.

title: Consensual sex between adolescents aged 16 to 18 years must not be treated as abuse: amicus curiae to SC
content: Amicus curiae and senior advocate Indira Jaising submits that the word ‘child’ in Section 2(d) of POCSO should not include individuals aged between 16 and 18 who engage in consensual sexual activity.

title: India's first hydrogen-powered train coach successfully tested at ICF Chennai: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: According to the Union Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw's social media X post, the country is working on a 1,200 horsepower hydrogen train, which will help India to place itself amongst the leaders in hydrogen-powered train technology

title: DMK government’s failure to take stern action has emboldened criminals: Palaniswami
content: The Leader of Opposition launched the AIADMK’s outreach initiative christened ‘Uruttukalum Thiruttukalum’ to circulate pamphlets containing a set of promises made by the DMK government in the run up to the 2021 Assembly elections

title: Bombay High Court junks petitions challenging Maharashtra’s farm procurement scheme, imposes ₹1 lakh cost
content: Bombay High Court dismisses baseless petitions challenging Maharashtra GR, imposes one lakh cost on petitioners

title: Delhi court dismisses money laundering case against Ratul Puri, Moser Baer and 11 others
content: Advocate Vijay Agarwal, appearing for Ratul Puri, argued that under Section 3 of the PMLA, the existence of “proceeds of crime” is a sine qua non (an essential condition) for prosecuting a money laundering offence

title: Kerala man-animal conflict: tribal woman’s death in Idukki a case of wild elephant attack, say police
content: Though Seetha’s death was initially found to be a case of man-animal conflict, after the post-mortem examination, the doctor allegedly informed the media that it was a case of murder

title: Telangana’s first quarter revenue receipts is 16.2% of estimates; 61% of ₹37,221 goes for interest payment, salaries and pensions
content: Total receipts including borrowings at Rs. 57,499 crore, just 20.19% of Rs. 2.84 lakh cr of budget estimates

title: Kerala rains: Heavy rainfall forecast in State for five days
content: Strong winds with a speed of 50 to 60 kmph are likely in isolated places in Kerala from Friday to Sunday, according to IMD

title: My mistake we couldn’t get caste census done earlier; correcting that now: Rahul Gandhi
content: Addressing a 'Bhagidari Nyay Sammelan' of OBCs, the Leader of Opposition in the Lok Sabha said the caste census in Telangana is a "political earthquake" that will cause a huge "aftershock" in the country

title: RCB pacer Yash Dayal accused of raping minor; FIR registered in Jaipur
content: Yash Dayal is already facing charges of sexual exploitation from a woman in Ghaziabad who has alleged that Dayal abused her after promising to marry her during a five-year relationship

title: Complete staff overhaul at two excise stations amid Navodayam 2.0 push
content: Director Excise and Prohibition Nishant Kumar ordered the reshuffle after departmental reviews flagged persistent underperformance at both stations

title: Doklam to open for tourists in September, eight years after India-China standoff
content: Sikkim site among three locations selected by Defence Ministry for battlefield tourism; infrastructure being developed in coordination with Army

title: Dhanbad mine 'collapse': NDRF, BCCL launch rescue operation
content: The operation by a 35-member squad of the NDRF and a 15-member BCCL mines’ rescue wing began around 11.30 am, after a futile attempt to search for the miners late on Thursday evening.

title: JD(U)-BJP 'conspiring' to get Tejashwi 'murdered', says Rabri Devi
content: Who else, but the JD(U)-BJP is involved in this conspiracy. They want him bumped off so that he is not around to challenge them in elections, alleges former Chief Minister Rabri Devi

title: Kairali AI Chip developers say allegations misplaced, cite support from MeitY and Kerala government
content: Makers of Digital University Kerala’s invention – Kairali AI Chip – maintain that their invention is an academic research initiative and not a commercial product. Save University Campaign Committee had raised concerns regarding the chips by alleging a lack of transparency in development and misuse of public funds

title: Operation Sindoor ongoing, military preparedness must remain very high: Chief of Defence Staff
content: The CDS said there are no runners-up in a war, and any military must be constantly alert and maintain a high degree of operational preparedness.

title: Karnataka CM urges Centre to supply urea as demand for fertiliser goes up with increase in area under crops
content: The Centre has allocated 11,17,000 tonnes of urea to Karnataka for kharif 2025, out of which 5,16,959 tonnes has been supplied, whereas the State’s requirement from April to July is 6,80,655 tonnes.

title: AAP says demolition notices issued to slum clusters in Shalimar Bagh, Shahdara, slams BJP
content: According to Ms. Atishi, residents of Indira Camp in Shalimar Bagh and Lalbagh in Shahdara — both established with allotment cards in 1990 — have been asked to vacate their homes within 15 days. Lalbagh slums are scheduled for demolition on July 31.

title: Gas leak from overturned LPG tanker triggers high alert on NH in Kerala’s Kanhangad
content: A special team, including gas company officials, fire force personnel and technical experts is overseeing the operation to safely transfer the gas to another tanker

title: ALTT, ULLU among over 20 OTT apps banned for obscene content
content: According to the government, the contents in question included sexual innuendos and in some cases long portions of sexually explicit scenes involving nudity thereby being pornographic in nature.

title: Supreme Court allows Kerala to withdraw plea against Governor, Centre resists
content: The Union Government said Kerala’s move is linked to the Tamil Nadu Governor case judgment of April 8

title: Nitish berates Opposition members for coming to Assembly dressed in black
content: Interestingly, quite a few MLAs of Mr. Kumar's JD(U) and his ally BJP had come to the House wearing helmets, claiming that they feared getting hit by the unruly Opposition members.

title: Karnataka government approves setting up residential schools for children of construction workers in 31 districts
content: Karnataka Building and Other Construction Workers’ Welfare Board to spend ₹1,125 crore on the project with each school costing between ₹34 crore and ₹38 crore

title: Depression to bring heavy rain in Odisha from July 25-28: IMD
content: The meteorological centre, Bhubaneswar, on July 25, 2025, issued a ‘red warning’ of extremely heavy rainfall at isolated places in Keonjhar and Mayurbhanj districts, and an ‘orange warning’ of very heavy rainfall in 10 other districts

title: Indian mission in Thailand issues travel advisory amidst ongoing unrest
content: The Thailand tourism authority said that “several attractions” in Ubon Ratchathani, Surin, Sisaket, Buriram, Sa Kaeo, Chanthaburi and Trat provinces are not recommended for visiting

title: Conspiracy to keep 'Bahujans' out of education, research: Rahul slams govt on vacant university posts
content: This is completely unacceptable. All vacant posts should be filled immediately, Bahujans should get their rights, not Manuwadi boycott, says T

title: Govindachamy’s prison escape raises serious questions about jail management, security in Kerala
content: Kerala Prisons and Correctional Services department suspends four jail officials on charges of grave security lapses, dereliction of duty and criminal negligence

title: Hyderabad | People without valid medical qualifications running unauthorised clinics for several years; TGMC initiates action
content: TGMC officials found medicines stored in open plastic containers and distributed by hand in an unsafe manner, with some reportedly being sold in nearby grocery shops

title: Supreme Court extends stay on summons to Rahul Gandhi in Savarkar case
content: The top court had stayed an Uttar Pradesh trial court summons issued to the Congress leader in an order in May while cautioning him from making “statements against our freedom fighters who gave us freedom”

title: Delhi HC seeks NIA's response on jailed MP Abdul Rashid's interim bail plea in terror funding case
content: A Bench of Justices Vivek Chaudhary and Shalinder Kaur issued notice to the NIA on the plea and listed the matter for further hearing on July 29

title: Telangana Deputy Bhatti makes a pitch for Cong, INDIA Bloc to raise OBC quota in Parliament
content: Mr. Bhatti, explained to the MPs that the entire process followed by the State Government and asserted that the survey was conducted in a meticulous and foolproof manner

title: India forms panel for COP-33 that it proposed to host
content: During his address at COP 28 in Dubai, Prime Minister Narendra Modi had proposed India as the host country for COP 33.

title: Parliament Monsoon session: Both Houses adjourned; Lok Sabha to take up discussion on Operation Sindoor on July 28
content: Four newly elected Rajya Sabha MPs from Tamil Nadu, including actor-turned-politician Kamal Haasan, took oath as member of the House

title: Govindachamy’s prison break evokes echoes of ‘Ripper’ Jayanandan’s daring 2013 escape from Thiruvananthapuram jail
content: On July 11, 2013, ‘Ripper’ Jayanandan, a death row prisoner accused of eight murders for gain and 14 burglaries, made a daring midnight escape from the Central Prison, Thiruvananthapuram

title: Vice-President election: ECI appoints Rajya Sabha Secretary General as Returning Officer
content: By convention, the Secretary General, Lok Sabha or the Secretary General, Rajya Sabha is appointed as the Returning Officer, by rotation.

title: Opposition MPs tear and throw ‘SIR’ posters in bin as symbolic rejection of exercise
content: The MPs also staged a protest march in the Parliament House complex, demanding the rollback as well as a discussion on the issue in both houses

title: DRDO successfully tests UAV-launched precision guided missile
content: DRDO has developed a UAV-Launched Missile – Extended Range (ULM-ER) munition designed for deployment via unmanned aerial platforms

title: Rajasthan school roof collapse LIVE: Seven students killed, locals say incident ‘happened due to negligence of administration’
content: Angry locals said they had informed the tehsildar and sub-divisional magistrate about the condition of the school building, but no action was taken.

title: Education Ministry permits seven new departments at Central University of Karnataka
content: The V-C said that CUK is establishing a Centre of Excellence in High Frequency Electronics in the campus, which aims at training manpower in high frequency electronics

title: Watch | Gujarat’s collapsing bridges: Cracks in infrastructure and accountability
content: Abhinay Deshpande reports on the tragedy in a State where at least six bridges have collapsed in the last four years

title: PM Modi now second longest serving in office in consecutive terms, surpasses Indira Gandhi’s record
content: Officials noted that Mr. Modi completes 4,078 days in office on Friday (July 25, 2025). Indira Gandhi was in the office in an unbroken stint for 4,077 days, from January 24, 1966 to March 24, 1977

title: Engineered for speed, not safety? The cost of Hyderabad’s ORR corridor
content: Hyderabad’s Outer Ring Road has seen over 30 deaths in 2025 and 369 in the past five years, with road safety analysts highlighting that most accidents are preventable errors like speeding, poor lane discipline, misuse of road shoulders, and inadequate driver training

title: PM Modi in Maldives LIVE: India will always support Maldives to strengthen its defence capabilities, says Modi
content: Mutual cooperation in field of defence and security is a testament to mutual trust, says PM Modi after talks with President Muizzu; India to provide a line of credit of $565 million to Maldives, PM Modi said.

title: Seven students killed as portion of school building collapses in Rajasthan; 5 staff members suspended
content: Angry locals said they had informed the tehsildar and sub-divisional magistrate about the condition of the school building but no action was taken.

title: Parliament Monsoon session updates, Day 5: Both Houses adjourned for the day, Om Birla attempts ending logjam with all-party meeting
content: While both Houses witnessed little business in the inaugural week of the monsoon session, an all-party meeting called by Speaker Om Birla offers hope in ending the logjam with a discussion on Operation Sindoor in Lok Sabha

title: Telangana caste survey draws praise of Congress top leadership
content: Telangana Chief Minister Reddy pointed out that the Telangana caste survey was a role model for the country

title: ‘Untainted’ teachers and non-teaching staff left in the lurch, both in Kolkata and Delhi
content: Despite protests and appeals, axed teachers struggle to find justice; both Supreme Court and High Court refuse to interfere in new school recruitment process

title: KITE deploys 2,161 robotic kits in schools in Kerala’s Kannur to boost practical learning in robotics
content: As part of revised ICT curriculum, a chapter in Class 10 textbook introduces students to robotics concepts through practical activities such as circuit construction, the use of sensors and actuators and controlling devices via computer programming

title: APTSL to offer cybersecurity auditing services nationwide
content: Andhra Pradesh Technology Services Limited expands cybersecurity services to private sector and other States, offering internships and awareness programs to combat cyber frauds

title: Citizenship under suspicion | How migrant workers from West Bengal are being detained as Bangladeshi infiltrators
content: Following the recent detention of residents of West Bengal by the Delhi police on suspicion of being illegal Bangladeshi immigrants, The Hindu finds out how an exchange of land parcels between the two neighbouring nations in 2015 is affecting those who opted for Indian citizenship

title: Questions on Siddaramaiah's tenure as CM persist; leaves for Delhi along with DKS
content: The two Karnataka leaders are in New Delhi in their third trip since June, even as an uneasy calm prevails in the State Congress unit where voices from both camps have fallen silent over the CM issue following a high command gag order

title: Rape and murder convict Govindachamy captured after escape from Kannur jail
content: Govindachamy was found hiding inside a well. He earlier escaped from the jail, prompting a Statewide manhunt

title: Cybercrime police arrest 45 in nationwide crackdown on online fraud
content: Of the 45 persons arrested, 17 were linked to trading fraud schemes, while nine others were apprehended for operating an illegal cybercrime call centre that defrauded citizens in India and the United States

title: In Odisha, crimes against women mount as courts and police falter
content: With a high case load, poor conviction and chargesheeting rates, Odisha’s response to crimes against women is inadequate

title: High alert in Kerala’s Kanhangad after LPG tanker overturns, holiday declared, traffic curbs in place
content: The tanker overturned into a roadside swamp while trying to give way to an oncoming bus on a narrow service road

title: For Karnataka students, the grass is still greener overseas
content: Be it geopolitical tensions, new immigration laws, visa troubles or non-availability of jobs, many students who had gone abroad from Karnataka have returned in the last couple of years. While uncertainty loomed over many of their futures, some have managed to bring their studies and careers back on track after either flying to other countries to complete their education or deciding to find jobs in India, writes Jahnavi T.R.

title: The 8 teams that most need to make a deal by trade deadline day
content: From the Yankees to the Dodgers, the sport's biggest giants are among the clubs that need to take action ahead of the July 31 deadline.

title: Will Yankees trade Spencer Jones? Why slugging prospect's rise is a deadline dilemma
content: The biggest drama of this year's deadline for the Yankees is playing out 350 miles northwest of the Bronx.

title: Trump issues executive order for college sports
content: President Donald Trump has directed members of his Cabinet to develop a plan in the next 30 days aimed at preserving college sports opportunities and preventing college athletes from becoming professionals.

title: Raiders releasing Wilkins; NFLPA files grievance
content: The Raiders have informed defensive tackle Christian Wilkins that he has been released. The NFLPA has filed a grievance on his behalf after the $35.2M of guaranteed money left on his contract was voided last month.

title: Rodgers opens with pick: Got it out of the way
content: Quarterback Aaron Rodgers said his interception wasn't a bad omen for his Steelers tenure, saying, "I'm going to throw some touchdowns, too," and expressing optimism about the team's Super Bowl hopes.

title: Kansas' Self hospitalized, has 2 stents inserted
content: Kansas coach Bill Self was hospitalized Thursday after experiencing "some concerning symptoms" and had two stents inserted. The school said he was expected to make a full recovery.

title: Clark rookie card nearly doubles auction record
content: A 1-of-1 numbered, autographed Caitlin Clark rookie card went straight to auction and sold for a record $660,000.

title: Iamaleava: Left Tennessee to come back home
content: UCLA quarterback Nico Iamaleava said Thursday that his main motivation for transferring this spring was proximity to family, not the money in his NIL deal.

title: Mariners land slugging 1B Naylor from D-backs
content: The Mariners bolstered their efforts to return to the playoffs by acquiring slugger Josh Naylor from the Diamondbacks on Thursday night.

title: Hurricanes lock in Blake with 8-year, $45M deal
content: Jackson Blake, coming off a rookie season in which he had 17 goals and 17 assists, signed an eight-year, $45 million contract extension with the Hurricanes.

title: 😂 How Happy Gilmore's sequel came to be
content: "Happy Gilmore 2" tees off 29 years later with sports stars, big cameos and a mission to honor the cult classic's legacy.

title: Can Florida repeat? How good will BYU be? Our men's hoops preview 100 days out
content: The Gators bolstered their roster, while the Cougars welcomed the top recruit. Here are 98 more things to know.

title: Will UConn go back-to-back? 100 predictions, more 100 days until women's hoops tips
content: From the biggest storylines to the top players to watch, we preview the 2025-26 women's basketball season.

title: SEC preview: Alabama, Georgia, Texas, LSU ... this conference is wide open
content: The SEC never lacks for talent or storylines -- and there's no reason to think 2025 will be any different.

title: Cameo guide: PGA stars, NFL champ, WWE icons and more
content: Nearly 30 years after the original, "Happy Gilmore 2" brings a who's who of stars from the PGA, NFL, NBA, WWE and more.

title: The best soccer teams of the past 25 years, ranked from 25 to 1
content: Let's pick the 25 best teams since 2000. How many Liverpool, Barcelona, Real Madrid and Bayern Munich squads make the list?

title: NBA summer storylines we're still watching, including the Kuminga saga at Golden State
content: The NBA's offseason flurry is winding down, but key restricted free agent and superstar extension decisions are still looming.

title: 'Pay Us What You Owe Us': Inside the WNBPA's statement-making All-Star Weekend
content: As CBA negotiations continue, WNBA players made a unified statement at the All-Star Game. Here's how they landed on "Pay Us What You Owe Us" shirts.

title: How the Valkyries have exceeded all expectations -- even their own
content: Expansion franchises have historically struggled in Year 1. But Golden State is fighting for a WNBA playoff spot.

title: Who are the best NFL draft prospects for next year? Debating the No. 1 player at 11 positions
content: Who is the top quarterback, edge rusher and corner in the 2026 NFL draft class? We debated every position's early lead.

title: McGee's Mascot Power Rankings: The best of the fun and furry in college football
content: From giant red blobs and 1,700-pound steer to coonskin caps and bears riding Harleys, these are the sport's top merrymakers.

title: MLB Power Rankings: A red-hot NL team surges up to debut at No. 1
content: Our first list of the second half sees a massive shake-up in the top five, with three clubs at their highest rankings of the seasons -- including a new squad at the top.

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window: Man United considering Kolo Muani in striker search
content: The summer transfer window is open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done? Get the latest every Friday.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea join Liverpool in Isak pursuit
content: Newcastle United striker Alexander Isak is open to leaving this summer, with Liverpool and Chelsea keen.

title: Greene to join exclusive club? Luzardo turns it around? Don't be surprised
content: Let's take a look into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Mock draft: Five QBs go in first round of 10-team superflex
content: The top signal-callers went early and quality wide receivers remained available in the middle rounds.

title: Key stats and numbers for Zayas-Garcia and 'Shu Shu'-Heita
content: Xander Zayas fights for his first world title, and Bruce Carrington for an interim belt. Here's a look at both fights through the numbers.

content: Brett Okamoto plays matchmaker and provides five matchups he wants the UFC to make happen by the end of 2025.

title: Chiefs' Travis Kelce shows out in training camp ahead of 'Happy Gilmore 2' cameo
content: The Kansas City Chiefs tight end had an impressive Day 2 of training camp before his "Happy Gilmore 2" appearance premieres.

title: England's savior Agyemang embracing super-sub role, but what's next for her?
content: Michelle Agyemang's breakout Euro 2025 has helped England reach the final, but what lessons can she learn from teammates and Spain's young talent?

title: Preview, times, predictions, stats and fun facts
content: Formula 1 heads to Spa-Francorchamps for round 13 of the 2025 season. Find out the stats, session times and predictions for the weekend.

title: PLL Week 9 preview: Key stats, players for Archers' Homecoming
content: The PLL heads back to Salt Lake City on Friday and Saturday. Here's the full schedule, key stats, injury notes and more.

title: Ohio to Virginia: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 5 quiz
content: Did someone say sports trivia? As "SportsCenter" continues its summer road trip, we're back for our fifth "state check."

title: 2K details reveal roadmap for NBA 2K26
content: Here's the schedule for all upcoming reveals and announcements for the upcoming basketball simulation.

title: Phase 1 Of Bihar Poll Roll Revision Complete, 65.2 Lakh Voters Risk Being Removed
content: The first phase of the Bihar Special Intensive Revision (SIR) exercise has been completed and the names of 65.2 lakh voters are likely to be excluded.

title: Agniveer Killed, 2 Soldiers Injured In Landmine Blast Near LoC In J&K's Poonch
content: An armyman was killed and two others injured in a landmine blast along the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district on Friday, officials said.

title: Special Prayers Held For Victims As Bangladesh Jet Crash Toll Rises To 32
content: Special prayers were held across Bangladesh on Friday, as the death count from a fighter jet crash into a school building in Dhaka rose to 32.

title: Meta To Ban Political Advertisements In EU From October, Cites Legal Issues
content: Meta Platforms will end political, electoral, social issue advertising on its platform in the European Union in early October because of the legal uncertainties due to EU rules targeting political advertising, the US social media company said.

title: As Cambodian Artillery Screamed Across Sky, Thai Woman Rushes To Save Cats
content: When the first salvo of Cambodian artillery screamed across her village, Thai seamstress Pornpan Sooksai's thoughts turned to her five beloved cats: Peng, Kung Fu, Cherry, Taro, and Batman.

title: Musk Issues Apology After Starlink Satellite Faces Hours-Long Global Outage
content: SpaceX chief Elon Musk's Starlink satellite internet service experienced an hours-long global network outage Thursday, which executives attributed to a key software issue.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Beyond Hesitations: Why The India-UK Trade Deal Is An Inflexion Point
content: For long, Indo-UK relations have been shadowed by the echoes of a colonial past. While that history must never be forgotten, it is crucial to acknowledge the evolving dynamics of a modern, democratic India and a globally engaged Britain.

title: Who Is Priya Sachdev Kapur, Wife Of Late Businessman Sunjay Kapur, At Centre Of Rs 30,000 Crore Empire
content: Priya Sachdev Kapur has emerged as a central figure in the high-stakes legal battle over control of the Rs 30,000-crore Sona Group empire.

title: Assam Rifles Recovers 1.97 Kg Drugs Worth Rs 6.6 Crore In Mizoram
content: In a targeted operation, Assam Rifles recovered 1.97 kg of methamphetamine tablets worth Rs 6.6 crore from the Tuikhuahtlang area of Aizawl, Mizoram, officials said. Three individuals were apprehended during the joint operation.

title: 'Put America First': Trump's Big Warning To Tech Firms Against Hiring Indians
content: US President Donald Trump has criticised American technology companies like Google, Microsoft and Apple for hiring workers from India and outsourcing manufacturing to China.

title: On Day 1 As MP, Kamal Haasan Raises Polarisation, Seeks Centrism
content: Actor-politician Kamal Haasan, freshly sworn in as a Rajya Sabha MP, has released a deeply reflective open letter addressed to citizens of the country including his home state, Tamil Nadu.

title: Missile Launched From A Drone: Major Boost To India's Military Capabilities
content: India has successfully test-fired a drone-launched precision-guided missile at a test range in Andhra Pradesh.

title: Kangana Ranaut, Himachal Governor's "Udta Punjab" Remark Sparks Row
content: A political row has erupted between Punjab and Himachal Pradesh after actor-turned-politician and BJP MP Kangana Ranaut linked the rising drug abuse in her home state to narcotics trafficking from Pakistan via Punjab.

title: Student Slits Man's Neck With Blade Out Of Jealousy Over Common Woman Friend
content: A 20-year-old B Com second-year student, who sells ice cream for a living, has been arrested for allegedly slitting the throat of a man out of jealousy over a shared connection with a female friend, a police official said on Friday.

title: What Does France's Recognition Of Palestine Mean For Middle East's Future
content: French President Emmanuel Macron has announced he will recognise Palestinian statehood, drawing angry rebukes from Israel and United States and opening the door for other major nations to potentially like Britain and Canada to perhaps follow suit.

title: When Bollywood Stars Visited Soldiers During Kargil War
content: Wounded soldiers at an Army medical unit during the Kargil war in 1999 were in for a surprise as a retinue of Bollywood stars like Salman Khan, Suniel Shetty, Ravina Tandon and Shabana Azmi walked in to boost their morale, recounts a new book.

title: Bhuwan Ribhu Becomes First Indian Lawyer To Receive World Law Congress Honour For Child Rights
content: For over two decades, Bhuwan Ribhu's legal fight against child exploitation earned him the World Jurist Association's Medal of Honour

title: Kremlin's New Cryptocurrency: How A7A5 Could Help Russia Evade Sanctions
content: Russia could be turning to a new cryptocurrency called A7A5 to allow money to flow in and out of the country and avoid Western sanctions.

title: Woman, 4-Year-Old Boy Killed After Being Hit By Speeding Truck In Maharashtra: Cops
content: A woman and a four-year-old boy were killed after a truck knocked them down outside a hospital in Maharashtra's Thane district, police said on Friday.

title: Prosecutor Who Handled US Capitol Attack, Sues Government Over His Firing
content: Michael Gordon prosecuted some of the most notorious members of the mob that attacked the US Capitol on January 6, 2021. His latest case to make is proving that the Justice Department fired him because he was good at his job.
